intro: Duroia eriopila f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth huito, is a variant of the huito plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are smooth to the touch, unlike the typical hairy foliage of the species. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often found in shaded forest environments. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
